message:
Greetings from IGTS - NSUT!!
We present the Round 2 of the Game Series "Rivals at War"!!

This game aims to introduce the players to the world of strategy making according to the situation! If Strategic thinking is what excites you, you must not miss the game!!

This Round is open for all irrespective of your participation in Round 1.
The overall winner of the "Game Series" will be decided based on the cumulative scores of both the rounds.

Follow the link: http://bit.ly/igts-nsut

The finalists of this round as well get to enter forthrightly into the final round of the ongoing recruitment drive for the executive committee 2019 of IGTS-NSUT and an exclusive feature on our monthly leader board!!

Register now and unleash your nefarious side!
Here is the list of newly recruited Game Theorists after the written and PI rounds. The KGPian Game Theory Society welcomes you all.

“Success is 20% skills and 80% strategy. You might know how to succeed, but more importantly, what’s your plan to succeed?” Jim Rohn
So come planned and let your strategy lead you to victory.
The KGPian Game Theory Society(Chapter of The Indian Game Theory Society) in association with Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur presents to you War of Wits, an on-spot strategy based event.

Do register at https://goo.gl/forms/cQINcryusLw4rz4x2

Event description:
Ready Player One is an on spot strategy based event where common sense will be your best friend. Participants don’t need to have any prior knowledge to participate in the event. Game No. 1 to Game No. 7 will have problem statements. Each having multiple rounds. After each round, the participants will be informed about their scores. Using which they can observe the behaviour of their opponents and strategize accordingly to maximise their score.

Each participating team is required to carry one fully charged laptop per team. The count of the teams are limited, so register on priority.

To register your teams click on a link below :
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfG7dqE-wMz-SLroeP2yFOJEAnF7bOupJQ5xu7tNANn0JQ5mQ/viewform

Event Details:
Date: 16th January
Venue: VGSoM
Time: 8 PM
Team: 3 members

The KGPian Game Theory Society shared The Indian Game Theory Society's post. The Indian Game Theory Society organised "Santa’s Lucky Number" and we are pleased to announce the results. As represented by the entries from the form, we received over 240+ responses out of which 1 was invalid. The average of the top 1/3rd bids or Set B (Bids >600) came out to be 738.007 and hence 3/4th of this average gave the winning value which came out to be 553 (rounded off from 553.505). Since we had one entry each at 552 and 554, both the participants are joint winners. Analysis : From the frequency graph, it can be seen the most common values were 666,777,888 and 444. Since the lower cap of top 1/3rd bids start from 600, the average has to be a large number. Taking its ¾, it is observed that it lies in the middle range which is around 500 or more accurately 553. Majority of numbers chosen were in the range 600-700 followed by 400-500 and then 1-100. Winners : Samarth Gulia (Number 554), NSUT Ananya De (Number 552), DTU

message: The KGPian Game Theory Society shared The Indian Game Theory Society's post. According to Bible, 7 is the most significant number and is the number of spiritual perfection. 888 is the number that signifies Jesus Christ while 666 is the devils number. Although some people believe 666 is again a godly number. But can any of these godly or christmasy number make you win a special gift this Christmas?🎅 IGTS presents Santa’s Lucky Number 🎅🎄 Its the festive season and Santa has a special present 🎁 for you. All you have to do is to select a number between 1 and 1000 and you can win Rs. 1000 Santa calculates the number as: ▪ He'll divide the bids into sets A and B. ▪ Set A has bottom 67% bids. (By Value) ▪ Set B has highest 33% bids. (By Value) ▪ He'll then find X as average of Set B. ▪ Now Santa's Lucky Number is 0.75*X. However you can only win, if you number lies in Set A If your number is closest to the Santa’s lucky number then you get a Special Christmas gift🎁 Guess your number here : www.tinyurl.com/igts-santa The result would be announced on www.fb.com/igts.the on 3rd January, 8PM.

message: The KGPian Game Theory Society shared The Indian Game Theory Society's album. We are proud to announce that we are one step closer towards achieving our goal of spreading Game Theory! 💫 The event was organized jointly by The Indian Game Theory Society teams from The Indian Game Theory Society-DTU, The KGPian Game Theory Society and The Indian Game Theory Society - NSIT who successfully collaborated with the Techfest, IIT Bombay to conduct our flagship event, Stratazenith - Techfest '19 (IIT Bombay) on 14th and 15th December. We thank everyone for the huge participation, overwhelming response and making our event a memorable one. 🎊

message: The KGPian Game Theory Society shared The Indian Game Theory Society's album. “The Game gives you a Purpose, the Real Game is to Find a Purpose.” The Indian Game Theory Society is proud to announce the successful organisation of two mind boggling challenges-Nashify and Stratazenith at Ensemble-Valhalla XLRI by The Indian Game Theory Society-DTU and The KGPian Game Theory Society. We thank all the Game Theory enthusiasts for their overwhelming participation and for making this a very successful event. <3

message: The KGPian Game Theory Society shared The Indian Game Theory Society's video. A few years back, Mr. Manoj Gadia with the motive of promoting the understanding of Game Theory and strategic thinking founded The Indian Game Theory Society. IGTS grew not only as a society but also as a family, across India, facing all hardships and failures but never for once deterring from aiming for excellence. After another completion of successful session where we opened new chapter in NSIT and IIT Bombay, collaborated with IIM Ahmedabad, IIM Lucknow, and XLRI to conduct several successful events. We also conducted events at IIT Bombay (Techfest'17), IIT Kanpur (Techkriti'18), and IIT Delhi (Tryst'18) in the last session. Continuing the legacy this time in Invictus 18 (DTU) we saw a huge footfall in our event and become a grand success. All of it could not have been possible without your constant mentorship and support. Hence from all the members of IGTS, we wish Mr. Manoj Gadia a very happy birthday and fortitude to accomplish your goals and the vision to inspire us to achieve ours. Events in the last one year : 1. October 2017 - In collaboration with ACA, CSE at IIT Kanpur 2. October 2017 - DTU 3. October 2017 - XLRI Jamshedpur 4. November 2017 - IIM Lucknow 5. November 2017 - IIM Rohtak 6. December 2017 - IIT Bombay 7. January 2018 - NIT Jamshedpur 8. January 2018 - SRCC 9. February 2018 - NSIT 10. February 2018 - DTU 11. February 2018 - IIM Ahmedabad 12. March 2018 - IIT Kanpur

The KGPian Game Theory Society shared The Indian Game Theory Society's post. Do you like to use or would like to use strategies to win? If you do, then get ready to stretch your mind to outwit your opponents. The Indian Game Theory Society, in collaboration with Equipoise - The economics club of IIM Ahmedabad present to you “Stratazenith – strategize to reach the zenith”! Stratazenith is a strategy based event modelled on game theory. Event details: Games will have problem statements based on simple real-life situations each having multiple rounds. After each round, the participants will be informed about their scores using which they can observe the behaviour of their opponents and strategize accordingly to maximise their scores. You don’t need to have any prior knowledge to participate in the event. Team size: 2 You only need to carry a pen. Prizes worth INR 4,000 to be won! Venue: CR7, New Campus, IIM Ahmedabad Date: 25th February, Sunday Time: 2:00 to 4:30pm

message:
Put your heart, mind, and soul into even your smallest acts. This is the secret of success - Swami Sivananda
Get ready to thrill your brain with games giving you adrenalin rush through the event.

Date : 21st/ January/ 2k18
Venue: Vikramshila
Timings: 9am- 6pm
Do register at https://goo.gl/forms/xIP7XyhYAhP8wVkV2

message:
Thinking is the hardest work there is, which is probably the reason   why so few engage in it. So, you think, you think? Come, find out this Sunday at 9 am, in F-127(the so called MAGGU ROOM). 

Look around, you are not the only one. Kindly do register at tinyurl.com/warofwits5 before coming. Psych yourself up, for this is not going to be easy.

Team KGTS heartily congratulates our alumnus Mr Prabhat Agarwal for being awarded the Silver Medal for the best academic performance among the graduating 4 year BTech CSE students in 2017.We wish him the best for all his future endeavors and hope that he continues to inspire us with his zeal for excellence.

The KGPian Game Theory Society shared The Indian Game Theory Society's photo. Today ,the IGTS team wishes our Founder President and Mentor Manoj Gadia a very Happy Birthday ! Under his guidance the last academic session has been quite a journey with IGTS organizing its events and spreading game theory across many campuses in India. Our DTU and IIM Rohtak chapters established in the last session also complete 1 year today. Here's hoping we continue to set new milestones in the upcoming session under his leadership. :)
